channel.title: Science on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Science on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Why the launch was scrubbed
item.description:
notes from day 14 at annarbor.com Why was the launch scrubbed this time?
Hydrogen leaks (STS-127) (STS-73)Thunderstorms (STS-93)Problem circuit card in the pyrotechnic initiator controller (STS-51) Perseid meteor shower (STS-51) I didn't see a complete list of all possible reasons, but there are lots of problems that can happen when you launch into space.  I watched two launches in the last few days - the SpaceX rocket which went up without a hitch, and the shuttle which went up on its 6th try, all very exciting to see.
